body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

With rook v1.1.1 and the yamls in `rook/cluster/examples/kubernetes/ceph` running 
```
kubectl apply -f object.yaml
kubectl apply -f object-user.yaml
```
directly without waiting will not create the user (reliably).

**Expected behavior:**

Operator should wait until the object store is really up and running.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Clone rook, checkout `v1.1.1` go to `rook/cluster/examples/kubernetes/ceph` and run: 
```
kubectl apply -f common.yaml
kubectl apply -f operator.yaml
kubectl apply -f object.yaml
kubectl apply -f object-user.yaml
```
This results in the following log:
```
$ k -n rook-ceph logs rook-ceph-operator-5d59547bf8-kjdkq | grep -C2 -e CephObjectStore -e my-user
2019-09-21 02:18:30.696635 I | op-object: creating object store my-store
2019-09-21 02:18:30.696829 I | exec: Running command: ceph osd crush dump --connect-timeout=15 --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring --format json --out-file /tmp/087005000
2019-09-21 02:18:31.083096 I | op-object: creating user my-user in namespace rook-ceph
2019-09-21 02:18:31.467289 I | exec: Running command: ceph osd crush dump --connect-timeout=15 --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring --format json --out-file /tmp/843776007
2019-09-21 02:18:31.473924 I | exec: Running command: ceph osd crush dump --connect-timeout=15 --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring --format json --out-file /tmp/275426746
--
2019-09-21 02:18:44.146251 I | exec: pool 'my-store.rgw.meta' created
2019-09-21 02:18:44.146509 I | exec: Running command: ceph osd pool set my-store.rgw.meta size 3 --connect-timeout=15 --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring --format json --out-file /tmp/823175133
2019-09-21 02:18:46.083507 I | op-object: waiting for CephObjectStore my-store to be created
2019-09-21 02:18:46.094020 I | op-object: waiting for CephObjectStore my-store to be initialized
2019-09-21 02:18:46.100300 I | op-object: CephObjectStore my-store has been created successfully
2019-09-21 02:18:46.100385 I | op-object: Creating user: my-user
2019-09-21 02:18:46.100415 I | exec: Running command: radosgw-admin user create --uid my-user --display-name my display name --rgw-realm=my-store --rgw-zonegroup=my-store --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring
2019-09-21 02:18:47.468146 I | exec: set pool 3 size to 3
2019-09-21 02:18:47.468405 I | exec: Running command: ceph osd pool application enable my-store.rgw.meta rook-ceph-rgw --yes-i-really-mean-it --connect-timeout=15 --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring --format json --out-file /tmp/250489240
--
2019-09-21 02:18:48.588974 I | cephclient: creating replicated pool my-store.rgw.meta succeeded, buf: 
2019-09-21 02:18:48.589123 I | exec: Running command: ceph osd pool get my-store.rgw.log all --connect-timeout=15 --cluster=rook-ceph --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/client.admin.keyring --format json --out-file /tmp/989488663
2019-09-21 02:18:48.724617 E | op-object: failed to create object store user my-user. failed to create user my-user. RadosGW returned error 1: failed to create user: failed to run radosgw-admin: Failed to complete '': exit status 5. 2019-09-21 02:18:48.625 7fbd505056c0  0 failed reading zonegroup info: ret -2 (2) No such file or directory
2019-09-21 02:18:48.625 7fbd505056c0  0 ERROR: failed to start notify service ((2) No such file or directory
2019-09-21 02:18:48.625 7fbd505056c0  0 ERROR: failed to init services (ret=(2) No such file or directory)
```
Deleting and recreating the user later works fine.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): `Container Linux by CoreOS 2023.5.0 (Rhyolite)`
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): `Linux node1 4.19.25-coreos #1 SMP Sat Mar 9 01:05:06 -00 2019 x86_64 AMD Opteron(tm) Processor 4234 AuthenticAMD GNU/Linux`
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: bare metal
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v1.1.1
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): `ceph version 14.2.4`
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.15.3
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): Typhoon v1.15.3
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): `HEALTH_WARN too few PGs per OSD (21 < min 30)`
title: ObjectUser does not wait (reliably) on ObjectStore
